item.text: The Israelites traveled on and camped in the rift valley plains of Moab on the side of the Jordan River across from Jericho.

<st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06834" class="">Zippor</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> the <st data-num="03478" class="">Israelites</st> had <st data-num="06213" class="">done</st> to the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st>.
And the Moabites were greatly afraid of the people, because they were so numerous. The Moabites were sick with fear because of the Israelites.

So the Moabites said to the elders of Midian, “Now this mass of people will lick up everything around us, as the bull devours the grass of the field.” Now Balak son of Zippor was king of the Moabites at this time.

And he <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> <st data-num="04397" class="">messengers</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="01160" class="">Beor</st> at <st data-num="06604" class="">Pethor</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">which</st> is <st data-num="05921" class="">by</st> the Euphrates <st data-num="05104" class="">River</st><n id="2" /> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> of Amaw,<n id="3" /> to <st data-num="07121" class="">summon</st> him, <st data-num="0559" class="">saying</st>, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, a <st data-num="05971" class="">nation</st> has <st data-num="03318" class="">come out</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>. They <st data-num="03680" class="">cover</st> the <st data-num="05869" class="">face</st><n id="4" /> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st>, and <st data-num="01931" class="">they</st> are <st data-num="03427">settling</st> <st data-num="04136" class="">next to</st> me.

So now, please come and curse this nation for me, for they are too powerful for me. Perhaps I will prevail so that we may conquer them and drive them out of the land. For I know that whoever you bless is blessed, and whoever you curse is cursed.”
So the elders of Moab and the elders of Midian departed with the fee for divination in their hands. They came to Balaam and reported to him the words of Balak.
He replied to them, “Stay here tonight, and I will bring back to you whatever word the Lord may speak to me.” So the princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.

And <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="04310" class="">Who</st> are <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="0582" class="">men</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> you?”

<st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, “<st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06834" class="">Zippor</st>, <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04124" class="">Moab</st>, has <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> a message <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me, saying,

‘<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, a <st data-num="05971" class="">nation</st> has <st data-num="03318" class="">come out</st><n id="1" /> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, and it <st data-num="03680" class="">covers</st> the <st data-num="05869" class="">face</st> of the <st data-num="0776" class="">earth</st>. <st data-num="01980" class="">Come</st> <st data-num="06258" class="">now</st> and <st data-num="06895" class="">put a curse</st> on them for me; <st data-num="0194" class="">perhaps</st> I will <st data-num="03201" class="">be able</st> to <st data-num="03898" class="">defeat</st> them<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="01644" class="">drive</st> them <st data-num="01644" class="">out</st>.’”<n id="3" />
But God said to Balaam, “You must not go with them; you must not curse the people, for they are blessed.”
So Balaam got up in the morning, and said to the princes of Balak, “Go to your land, for the Lord has refused to permit me to go with you.”
So the princes of Moab departed and went back to Balak and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
Balak again sent princes, more numerous and more distinguished than the first.

And they <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="03541" class="">Thus</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">says</st> <st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st> of <st data-num="06834" class="">Zippor</st>: ‘<st data-num="04994" class="">Please</st> do <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> let anything <st data-num="04513" class="">hinder</st> you from <st data-num="01980" class="">coming</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me.
For I will honor you greatly, and whatever you tell me I will do. So come, put a curse on this nation for me.’”
Balaam replied to the servants of Balak, “Even if Balak would give me his palace full of silver and gold, I could not transgress the commandment of the Lord my God to do less or more.
Now therefore, please stay the night here also, that I may know what more the Lord might say to me.”

<st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> <st data-num="03915" class="">that night</st>, and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “<st data-num="0518" class="">If</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> have <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> to <st data-num="07121" class="">call</st> you, <st data-num="06965" class="">get up</st> and <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> them, <st data-num="0389" class="">but</st> the <st data-num="01697" class="">word</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> I will <st data-num="01696" class="">say</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you, that you must <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st>.”
So Balaam got up in the morning, saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab.
Then God’s anger was kindled because he went, and the angel of the Lord stood in the road to oppose him. Now he was riding on his donkey and his two servants were with him.

And the donkey saw the angel of the Lord standing in the road with his sword drawn in his hand, so the donkey turned aside from the road and went into the field. But Balaam beat the donkey, to make her turn back to the road.
Then the angel of the Lord stood in a path among the vineyards, where there was a wall on either side.
And when the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she pressed herself into the wall, and crushed Balaam’s foot against the wall. So he beat her again.
Then the angel of the Lord went farther, and stood in a narrow place, where there was no way to turn either to the right or to the left.
When the donkey saw the angel of the Lord, she crouched down under Balaam. Then Balaam was angry, and he beat his donkey with a staff.
Then the Lord opened the mouth of the donkey, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you that you have beaten me these three times?”

And <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to the <st data-num="0860" class="">donkey</st>, “You have <st data-num="05953" class="">made</st> me <st data-num="05953" class="">look stupid</st>; I <st data-num="03863" class="">wish</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="03426" class="">there were</st> a <st data-num="02719" class="">sword</st> in my <st data-num="03027" class="">hand</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> I would <st data-num="02026" class="">kill</st> you <st data-num="06258" class="">right now</st>.”

The <st data-num="0860" class="">donkey</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st>, “Am <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> <st data-num="03808">not</st> your <st data-num="0860" class="">donkey</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> you have <st data-num="07392 05921">ridden</st> <st data-num="05750" class="">ever since</st> I was yours <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>? Have I <st data-num="05532" class="">ever</st> <st data-num="05532" class="">attempted</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="06213" class="">treat</st> you <st data-num="03541" class="">this way</st>?”<n id="2" /> And he <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="03808" class="">No</st>.”
Then the Lord opened Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel of the Lord standing in the way with his sword drawn in his hand; so he bowed his head and threw himself down with his face to the ground.
The angel of the Lord said to him, “Why have you beaten your donkey these three times? Look, I came out to oppose you because what you are doing is perverse before me.

The <st data-num="0860" class="">donkey</st> <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> me and <st data-num="05186" class="">turned</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">from</st> me <st data-num="02088" class="">these</st> <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="07272" class="">times</st>. <st data-num="0194" class="">If</st><n id="1" /> she had <st data-num="0194" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05186" class="">turned</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">from</st> me, I would have <st data-num="02026" class="">killed</st> you but <st data-num="02421" class="">saved</st> her <st data-num="02421" class="">alive</st>.”
Balaam said to the angel of the Lord, “I have sinned, for I did not know that you stood against me in the road. So now, if it is evil in your sight, I will go back home.”
But the angel of the Lord said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but you may only speak the word that I will speak to you.” So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at a city of Moab that was on the border of the Arnon at the boundary of his territory.

<st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st>, “Did I <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">again and again</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you to <st data-num="07121" class="">summon</st> you? <st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> did you <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> me? <st data-num="0552" class="">Am</st> I <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="03513" class="">honor</st> you?”<n id="2" />

<st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st>, “<st data-num="02009" class="">Look</st>, I have <st data-num="0935" class="">come</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you. <st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st>, <st data-num="03201" class="">am</st> I <st data-num="03201" class="">able</st><n id="1" /> to <st data-num="01696" class="">speak</st><n id="2" /> just <st data-num="03972" class="">anything</st>? I must <st data-num="01696" class="">speak</st><n id="3" /> only the <st data-num="01697" class="">word</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="07760" class="">puts</st> in my <st data-num="06310" class="">mouth</st>.”

So <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">went</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st>, and they <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> to <st data-num="07155" class="">Kiriath Huzoth</st>.

And <st data-num="01111" class="">Balak</st> <st data-num="02076" class="">sacrificed</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">bulls</st> and <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st>, and <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> some<n id="1" /> to <st data-num="01109" class="">Balaam</st>, and to the <st data-num="08269" class="">princes</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him.
Then on the next morning Balak took Balaam, and brought him up to Bamoth Baal. From there he saw the extent of the nation.
